questions.text: Post-earthquake, some buildings were destroyed, and the building codes were changed to make more earthquake resistant buildings. This is known as:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Disaster Mitigation Emergency prevention and mitigation involves measures designed either to prevent hazards from causing emergency or to lessen the likely effects of emergencies.

Highyeild:

Disaster mitigation measures aim to reduce the vulnerability of the system. It complements disaster preparedness and response activities and includes measures taken to lessen the likely effects of emergencies. Some of these measures are: Flood mitigation Land-use planning Improved building codes Reduction and protection of vulnerable populations or structures. Disaster response includes activities such as rescue and first aid, field care, triage and tagging that form a part of the emergency care needed in the first few hours after a disaster. Disaster reconstruction is a part of the recovery phase after a disaster. Disaster rehabilitation refers to measures that lead to the restoration of pre-disaster conditions. These measures include water supply restoration, food safety, basic sanitation, personal hygiene, and vector control.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A & B. Disaster response an impact includes search, rescue, field care, triage, tagging, identification of dead. Option D. Disaster preparedness is a program of longterm development activities whose goals strengthen the overall capacity of a country to manage efficiently all types if emergency.

Solution:

Health Motivation

Highyeild:

The health belief model is a social psychological health behavior change model developed to explain and predict health-related behaviors, particularly in regard to the uptake of health services.

questions.text: According to the new WHO guidelines, what is the minimum number of antenatal visits recommended to have a positive pregnancy outcome?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

8

Highyeild:

Antenatal care models with a minimum of eight contacts are recommended. A woman’s ‘contact’ with her antenatal care provider should be more than a simple ‘visit’ but rather the provision of care and support throughout pregnancy. It recommends pregnant women to have their first contact in the first 12 weeks’ gestation, with subsequent contacts taking place at 20, 26, 30, 34, 36, 38 and 40 weeks’ gestation.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, B and D are false.

Extraedge:

In India minimum 4 visits are recommended.

questions.text: A study for smoking and lung cancer finds the attributable risk percentage for smoking as 95%. All of the following are correct interpretations except:

options.label: A
options.text: 95% cases of lung cancer in smokers can be avoided if smoking is eliminated

options.label: B
options.text: 95% cases of lung cancer can be avoided in the general population if smoking is eliminated

options.label: C
options.text: 5% of lung cancer in smokers is not associated with smoking

questions.correct_answer: B. 95% cases of lung cancer can be avoided in the general population if smoking is eliminated
questions.explanation:
Solution:

95% cases of lung cancer can be avoided in the general population if smoking is eliminated

Highyeild:

Relative risk is the ratio of the risks for an event for the exposure group to the risks for the non-exposure group. Attributable risk: Proportion of a disease in exposed individuals that can be attributed to an exposure. It is the risk difference between exposed and unexposed groups.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

Table:

#MANTRA

questions.text: The image shown depicts ____________ level of prevention?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Disability Limitation Lymphatic filariasis / Elephantiasis, is a chronic mosquito-borne infection caused by Wuchereria bancrofti, Brugia malayi, and B. timori. Elephantiasis, or late-stage lymphedema, is associated with significant disability and would require different methods (including surgery) to reduce swelling and complications.

Highyeild:

Levels of Prevention Primordial prevention: Prevention of emergence of development of risk factors. Done by health education. Primary prevention: Action taken prior to the onset of disease. Done by health promotion & specific protection. Secondary prevention: Action which halts the progress of a disease. Done by early diagnosis & treatment. Tertiary prevention: Action taken during the progression/ end of disease. Done by disability limitation & rehabilitation.

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect for the vaccine vial monitor? Use if the inner-square is lighter than the outer circle. Discard if inner square starts changing colour, but is lighter than outer circle Discard when inner square and outer circle are same colour Discard in inner square is darker in colour Calculation of expiry date is done using VVM Choose the correct answer from below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

5

Highyeild:

A vaccine vial monitor is a thermochromic label put on vials containing vaccines which gives a visual indication of whether the vaccine has been kept at a temperature which preserves its potency. Calculation of expiry date is not done using VVM.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are all true statements.

questions.text: Which of the following indicators shows the efficacy of early detection of leprosy in the NLEP?

options.label: B
options.text: Proportion of Multi Bacillary among new cases

options.label: D
options.text: Proportion of Grade II disability cases among the general population

questions.correct_answer: D. Proportion of Grade II disability cases among the general population
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Proportion of Grade II disability cases among the general population

Highyeild:

The National Leprosy Eradication Programme (NLEP) was introduced in 1983, under the National Health Mission (NHM). The vision of the NLEP is 'Leprosy-free India'. Disability prevention and medical rehabilitation (DPMR) is the priority of the programme.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, B, and C are false.

Extraedge:

Main indicators for evaluating case detection: Proportion of grade-2 disabilities among new cases. Proportion of females among new cases. Proportion of child (0-14 years) among new cases. Child rate per 1,00,000 population. Scheduled caste new case detection rate. Scheduled tribe new case detection rate.

questions.text: Which of the following is not the moment of hand hygiene?

options.label: A
options.text: When your hands are visibly soiled

questions.correct_answer: A. When your hands are visibly soiled
questions.explanation:
Solution:

When your hands are visibly soiled

Highyeild:

There are 5 moments of hand hygiene: Before touching a patient. , Before clean/aseptic procedures. After body fluid exposure/risk. After touching a patient. After touching patient surroundings.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are all moments of hand hygiene.

Extraedge:

Benefit: Minimize the risk of transmission of microorganisms between a healthcare worker, the patient, and the environment.
